Job Title: Regulatory Compliance Analyst

Location: Atlanta Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
About MAXIS GBN MAXIS GBN was co-founded in 1998 by MetLife and AXA, two of the largest and most trusted insurance companies in the world. In 2016, MAXIS GBN became a joint venture and established itself in London with offices at Monument where we employ an international team of nearly 90 staff, with another 50 based in 12 locations around the world. At MAXIS GBN, we work with multinational companies to help them deliver employee benefits to their staff around the world. We offer global pooled and captive solutions as well as comprehensive wellness packages. We do this through working with a network of 140 local insurance companies (members) in over 120 markets across the globe. More than 60% of our member insurers are owned by MetLife or AXA, the other 40% are independent local insurers – all are experts in their markets and help us to find the right solutions for the local offices of multinationals and their employees based there. Our London headquarters houses support services from global marketing to finance to client reporting and underwriting while working with colleagues based in offices in locations across Europe, the USA and Asia. Summary of Responsibilities MAXIS GBN is seeking a Regulatory/US Compliance Analyst to join the Risk & Compliance Team (who are based in the UK) permanently. Reporting to the Regulatory Compliance Manager – this role will be based in the Atlanta and focus on regulatory compliance and data protection for the US office.  Responsible will include:· Assisting with regulatory compliance matters and strategy for MAXIS, predominantly for the US business.· Provide guidance and support to the MAXIS business (US, but globally when needed).· Helping the Regulatory Compliance Manager to keep he regulatory mappings for all MAXIS jurisdictions up to date.· Assisting the Regulatory Compliance Manager with regular horizon scanning and keep up to date with regulatory changes and new/emerging regulations in the US (Federal and State regulations). Assisting with other jurisdictions as needed.· Helping to conduct regulatory analysis to determine if MAXIS is in scope of new/changing regulations. · Keeping up to date with all regulators via alerts, newsletters, websites, webinars etc (predominantly US but also other jurisdictions MAXIS has branches/subsidiaries).· Work closely with Compliance, Risk and Legal teams to ensure regulatory changes are incorporated.· Completing all regulatory filings for all MAXIS US entities (other branches/subsidiaries as needed).· Developing and maintaining a good relationship with MAXIS teams to align on regulatory topics when needed.· Assisting the Regulatory Compliance Manager in producing management information.· Ensuring that the US Distribution activities, sales flow, product and marketing materials are in compliance with applicable regulations. · Participating in some regulatory projects (where necessary). Required/Desired Competencies · 3+ years’ experience in a compliance role within financial services. · Good knowledge of the US regulatory landscape (in particular regulation applicable to Insurance and Reinsurance). Knowledge of other jurisdictions (e.g. UK) would be beneficial. · Strong IT and Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) skills essential. · Good analytical, communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills.· Project management skills and ability to meet deadlines. · Excellent attention to detail and ability to perform analysis. · Experience in insurance/reinsurance markets would be beneficial.· Ability to work independently as well as within a team.

Experience Level (if available): None
